content.description:
This is a complete traverse with a great variety of holds and movement. Like Escobarbarian, it's a variation on a very similar problem.

Sit start with hands matched in the seam which is located at the rock's southwest corner.  From there, move up to the hueco, then begin traversing east by stemming across the rock's break.  At that point, continue traversing east on the vertical/slab by using a series of sharp pockets.  Eventually top it out when you reach the large, vertical crack.
content.protection: A few pads, the landing is great though; however, be careful of broken glass. It seems the area was home to partiers at one point.
content.location: This is on the South face of Tweeter Rock.

content.description:
Sit start with a pair of edges. From there, pull up and match on the hueco, then gain the small shelf, reach the horizontal rail above, then the lip, and top it out.

The shelf at the halfway point is still a little friable, but some more traffic will likely clean it up.
content.protection: A pair of pads will work. The landing is very good.
content.location: It climbs the south section of Tweeter's west face.

content.description:
Escobarbarian is similar to

Those That Carry Antlers

, but I felt it was the better, more direct line.  Instead of traversing across the boulder, it goes straight up around the half way point. More or less a variation that could just climb straight up from the start anyway.

Sit start with hands matched on the seam.  From there, work up to the hueco, then trend right through some sharp crimps (crux), stem the gap, gain the the horizontal rail, then head straight up using the large sidepull for a solid topout.
content.protection: A few pads, the landing is great though.
content.location: This is on the South face of Tweeter Rock.
